physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white portrait photograph. It is of a man, taken from waist up. He is wearing a head dress on his head, and a black long-sleeved open buttoned shirt over a white inner shirt. He can be seen wearing a wrap cloth underneath, around the waist. He is facing downwards to the left. The photograph is slightly faded, but there are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: This carte-de-visite format photograph of a Malay man was taken in the studio of John Thomson, who arrived in Singapore in 1862 and established a studio at Beach Road on 16 June that year. Thomson would later travel to photograph in Siam and China before embarking on a series on street life in London.
title_text: Portrait of a Malay man Photograph of a Malay man
subject_terms_2: Carte de visite photographs Portrait photography Ethnic costume Malays (Asian people)
